books.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the future.

books.name: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A story about the jazz age in the United States in the 1920s.

books.name: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A novel about the events around a teenager named Holden Caulfield.

books.name: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic World State.

books.name: The Da Vinci Code
books.author: Dan Brown
books.description: A mystery thriller novel that explores an alternative religious history.

books.name: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: An exploration of the history and impact of Homo sapiens.

books.name: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A fantasy novel and prelude to The Lord of the Rings.

books.name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: The first book in the Harry Potter series.

books.name: The Shining
books.author: Stephen King
books.description: A horror novel about a family staying in an isolated hotel.

categories.name: Classic Literature
categories.description: Classic literature refers to the works of literature that are considered to be of high quality and lasting value, typically written in the 19th and early 20th centuries.

categories.name: Science Fiction
categories.description: Science fiction is a genre of speculative fiction that typically deals with imaginative and futuristic concepts such as advanced science and technology, space exploration, time travel, parallel universes, and extraterrestrial life.

categories.name: Mystery
categories.description: Mystery fiction is a genre of fiction usually involving a mysterious death or a crime to be solved. Often with a closed circle of suspects, each suspect must have a credible motive and a reasonable opportunity for committing the crime.

categories.name: Non-Fiction
categories.description: Non-fiction is a genre of literature that is based on facts and real events. It includes biographies, autobiographies, essays, memoirs, and journalistic works.

categories.name: Fantasy
categories.description: Fantasy is a genre of speculative fiction set in a fictional universe, often inspired by mythology and folklore. It typically features magical elements, supernatural phenomena, or imaginary creatures.
